BraTS-MET-00030-000: Multiple clustered abnormal signal shadows are seen in the cerebellum, the junction of the left frontal parietal lobes, and the right frontal lobe; the larger one is located in the right cerebellar hemisphere, showing slightly low signal on T1W, and signals on T2W, FLAIR. Perilesional edema signal is visible; significant enhancement of the lesion is seen on T1C, measuring approximately 69*60*55 mm. There is no shift of midline structures.
BraTS-GLI-00444-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is visible adjacent to the left lateral ventricle, demonstrating slightly low signal on T1W images, slightly high signal on T2W and FLAIR images, with uneven enhancement post-contrast on T1C. The lesion has clear boundaries and measures approximately 40*37*48 mm, with mild surrounding edema. The midline structures are displaced to the right, and the posterior horn of the left lateral ventricle is compressed and narrowed.
BraTS-MET-00009-000: Multiple clustered abnormal signals are seen in the bilateral parieto-occipital lobes. The larger lesion is located in the left occipital lobe, presenting with mixed iso- to hypo-intense signals on T1-weighted images, mixed high- to low-intense signals on T2-weighted images, high signal on FLAIR, and peripheral enhancement on T1 post-contrast with non-enhancing regions within, measuring approximately 77*60*74 mm. Flaky T1 low signal, T2 high signal, and FLAIR high signal are visible around. Midline structures are not shifted.
BraTS-GLI-01436-000: An approximately round-shaped abnormal signal focus is visible on the left frontoinsula and basal ganglia region, demonstrating low signal on T1-weighted images with some high signal, mixed high and low signal on T2-weighted and FLAIR images, and partial, patchy enhancement on T1 contrast-enhanced images. The lesion size is approximately 46*61*57mm. There is extensive edema in the surrounding brain parenchyma with compression of the right lateral ventricle and a slight shift of the midline structures to the left.
BraTS-MET-00132-000: Multiple punctate, patchy, and round-like abnormal signal shadows can be observed in the left frontal lobe, right lateral ventricle, temporal operculum, cerebellar hemisphere, and on the left side of the brainstem. The larger lesion is located in the right lateral ventricle, which exhibits a high signal on T1-weighted images, slightly higher signal on T2-weighted images, and high signal on FLAIR. Post-contrast enhancement shows lesion border enhancement, with a size of approximately 27*35*23 mm. There is no midline shift.
BraTS-MEN-00074-005: An abnormal signal nodule is visible on the left side behind the falx cerebri, presenting with isointense signal on T1-weighted images, slightly hyperintense signal at the center and hypointense signal at the edges on T2-weighted images, mixed-signal on FLAIR sequence, and significant enhancement after contrast administration with clear boundaries, measuring approximately 15*13*16 mm. No midline shift is observed.
BraTS-GLI-01090-000: The left frontal lobe shows an irregular abnormal signal focus, which presents with mixed high and low signals on T1W, mixed high and low signals on T2W and FLAIR, with uneven enhancement on T1C. The boundaries are not well defined, measuring about 48*72*72mm. Perilesional brain parenchymal edema is noted, with the frontal horn of the left lateral ventricle being compressed, and a shift to the right of midline structures.
BraTS-MEN-01350-000: There is a mass-like abnormal signal adjacent to the falx cerebri on the left frontal parietal region. The shape is irregular, demonstrating isointense signal on T1-weighted images and slightly hyperintense signal on T2-weighted images. There is hyperintense signal on FLAIR imaging, with surrounding edema. Post-contrast T1-weighted images show significant and heterogeneous enhancement of the lesion, measuring approximately 46*67*55 mm. There is a slight rightward shift of midline structures.
BraTS-MEN-00696-000: On the right side of the cerebral longitudinal fissure, there is a mass-like abnormal signal shadow, exhibiting isointense on T1-weighted images, slightly hyperintense on T2-weighted images, and hyperintense on FLAIR. It shows obvious enhancement on T1 with contrast and measures approximately 47*96*58mm, with surrounding edema. No midline shift is observed. Adjacent to the posterior longitudinal fissure of the brain, below the right temporal bone plate, and on the right side of the cerebellar tentorium, there is a mass-like abnormal signal shadow which has a similar signal pattern to the lesion in the cerebral longitudinal fissure and measures approximately the same. No midline shift is observed.
BraTS-MET-00382-000: In the left parietal lobe, there is a mass-like abnormal signal shadow with central low signal and peripheral iso signal on T1W, mixed signal on T2W, iso to low signal on FLAIR, and significant heterogeneous enhancement of the lesion on T1C with surrounding large edematous signal. The dimensions of the lesion are approximately 44*58*60mm. There is no midline shift.
BraTS-GLI-00590-000: An irregular abnormal signal focus can be seen in the right temporal lobe, appearing as mixed low signal on T1-weighted images, and mixed high signal on T2-weighted and FLAIR images. There is extensive edema in the surrounding brain parenchyma, compression of the right lateral ventricle, and a shift of midline structures to the left.
BraTS-MEN-01411-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is observed beneath the skull plate in the right temporal area, exhibiting an isointense signal on T1-weighted images, isointense on T2-weighted images, slightly hyperintense on FLAIR images, and shows significant enhancement post-contrast (T1C). It measures approximately 70*131*97 mm, with surrounding edema and compression of the right lateral ventricle leading to narrowing. Midline structures are shifted to the left.
BraTS-GLI-01447-000: On the right parietal lobe, there is an irregular abnormal signal focus, demonstrating iso- to low signal on T1-weighted images, heterogeneous high signal on T2-weighted and FLAIR sequences, and marked ring-like enhancement on T1 post-contrast (T1C), with indistinct boundaries, measuring approximately 50*72*62mm. Extensive edema is noted in the surrounding brain parenchyma, with compression on the posterior horn of the right lateral ventricle. No midline shift is observed.
BraTS-GLI-01016-000: A cluster of abnormal signals is visible in the left temporal lobe, which presents as slightly hypointense on T1-weighted images (T1W), hyperintense on T2-weighted images (T2W), and hyperintense on FLAIR images. BraTS-MEN-00131-000: A mass-like abnormal signal shadow is seen in the anterior interhemispheric fissure, showing iso-signal on T1W, iso-signal on T2W, slightly hyperintense signal on FLAIR, and significant uneven enhancement on T1C. The size is approximately 111*117*95mm, with peritumoral edema. BraTS-MEN-00898-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is visible in the left frontal lobe, presenting with iso-intense signal on T1-weighted sequence, iso-intense signal on T2-weighted sequence, slightly hyperintense signal on FLAIR sequence, and obvious enhancement on T1-weighted contrast sequence; with an approximate size of 55*70*70mm, and peritumoral edema. BraTS-GLI-00498-000: An irregular lesion displaying abnormal signal intensity is seen in the left temporal lobe, presenting as iso- to hypointense on T1-weighted images, and as hyperintense mixed signals on T2-weighted and FLAIR sequences, with patchy and ring-like enhancements observed on T1 post-contrast. BraTS-GLI-00496-000: An abnormal signal focus is seen in the right temporal lobe, presenting as isointense on T1-weighted images, hyperintense on T2-weighted and FLAIR images, with obvious nodular enhancement after gadolinium contrast (T1C), and unclear boundaries. BraTS-MEN-00622-000: Under the left parietal bone and in the left frontal-temporal region, a mass-like abnormal signal shadow is observed, presenting with iso-signal on T1W imaging, slightly hyperintense signal on T2W imaging, and hyperintense signal on FLAIR imaging. BraTS-GLI-01294-000: Multiple irregular abnormal signal foci can be seen in the left frontal-temporal-insular lobes, presenting as iso- to hypointense on T1-weighted images and hyperintense with mixed signals on T2-weighted and FLAIR images. BraTS-GLI-00801-000: An irregular abnormal signal focus can be seen in the right temporal-occipital lobe, which presents with low signal on T1-weighted imaging with some high signals, mixed high and low signals on T2-weighted imaging, and FLAIR imaging, and significant ring-like enhancement on T1-contrast imaging, with ill-defined boundaries, approximately 58*78*67 mm in size. BraTS-MET-00129-000: A mass-like abnormal signal lesion is visible in the right occipital lobe, presenting as a low signal on T1-weighted images with a few punctate high signals at the center, mixed signals on T2-weighted and FLAIR sequences, and a large area of surrounding edema. BraTS-GLI-00012-000: Irregular abnormal signal foci are seen in both frontal lobes, crossing the midline, presenting with iso to low signal on T1W with some high signal, mixed high and low signal on T2W and FLAIR, with uneven enhancement on T1C, and indistinct boundaries. BraTS-MEN-00606-000: Underneath the left parietal bone, a mass-like abnormal signal shadow can be seen. BraTS-GLI-00110-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is seen in the left frontal lobe, showing a slightly low signal on T1-weighted images, a slightly high signal on T2-weighted images, and a slightly high signal on FLAIR images. BraTS-MEN-00071-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is observed in the anterior interhemispheric fissure, presenting with an isointense signal on T1-weighted imaging (T1WI), an isointense signal on T2-weighted imaging (T2WI), a slightly hyperintense signal on Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery (FLAIR), and heterogeneous enhancement on T1 post-contrast (T1C) imaging. BraTS-MET-00114-000: Multiple nodules are seen in the bilateral frontal, parietal, temporal, occipital lobes, and cerebellum, the larger one is located in the right parietal lobe, displaying low signal on T1-weighted images, mixed high and low signals on T2-weighted images, low signal on FLAIR, with significant enhancement on T1 post-contrast sequence, measuring approximately 51*63*60 mm, with surrounding patchy areas of low signal on T1-weighted, high signal on T2-weighted and FLAIR sequences. BraTS-GLI-00242-000: On the left parietal lobe and adjacent to the posterior horn of the lateral ventricle, there is a mass-like abnormal signal shadow, presenting as a low signal on T1-weighted imaging, a high signal on T2-weighted imaging, and a mixed low and high signal on FLAIR. BraTS-MET-00290-000: A cystic-solid lesion is observed in the left frontal lobe, irregular in shape, displaying iso- to hypointense signal on T1-weighted (T1W) images and mixed signal intensity on T2-weighted (T2W) images. BraTS-MET-00381-000: A mass-like area of abnormal signal is observed in the right parietal lobe, which appears as a low signal on T1-weighted imaging, a high signal on T2-weighted imaging, and a high signal on FLAIR sequence. BraTS-MET-00172-000: Multiple nodular and patchy abnormal signals are observable in both cerebral hemispheres and the right cerebellar hemisphere, with the larger ones located in the right parietal lobe, presenting mixed high and low signals on T1W and T2W sequences. BraTS-GLI-01146-000: Multiple irregular abnormal signal foci are visible in the right frontal lobe and the knee of the corpus callosum, presenting with mixed high and low signals on T1W, high mixed signals on T2W and FLAIR, and marked patchy and ring-like enhancement on T1C. BraTS-MET-00380-000: Patchy abnormal signal shadows are seen in the splenium of the corpus callosum and the right parieto-occipital lobe, with the larger lesion located in the right parieto-occipital lobe, crossing the midline locally, and presenting with uneven hyperintense signal on T1-weighted images (T1W), hyperintense signal on T2-weighted images (T2W) and Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery (FLAIR) sequence, with extensive perilesional edema signal. BraTS-MEN-00023-000: A mass-like cystic-solid occupying lesion is observed in the right frontal-parietal lobe, with an irregular shape. BraTS-MEN-00650-000: A small mass-like abnormal signal is visible beneath the skull plate in the right frontal region, presenting as isointense on T1W, isointense on T2W, slightly hyperintense on FLAIR, with marked enhancement on T1C, measuring approximately 13*12*13mm. BraTS-MEN-00636-000: A mass-like abnormal signal is seen below the skull plate of the right frontal region, which presents with isointense signal on T1-weighted imaging (T1W), isointense signal on T2-weighted imaging (T2W), and hyperintense signal on Fluid-attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR). BraTS-GLI-00061-000: Multiple quasi-circular abnormal signal foci are visible in the left temporal lobe and hippocampus, appearing as low signal on T1W imaging, high signal on T2W and FLAIR imaging with a mixed high and low signal, and showing obvious ring-like enhancement on T1C. BraTS-GLI-00698-000: At the junction of the right temporal and parietal lobes, an irregular abnormal signal lesion is seen, presenting with isointense to low signal on T1-weighted images, high mixed signal on T2-weighted and FLAIR images, and marked ring-like enhancement on T1-weighted images with contrast (T1C).
